title.narrative: IPCC 2013 - Support for Urban Planning Capacities in East Jerusalem

description.narrative: The project aims to build a capacity of Palestinian professionals informal leaders community social workers and young activists from six Jerusalem neighbourhoods in order to involve them in planning of their neighbourhoods and introduce them to assurance a ctive roles in the planning process. This group will serve as an advocacy and pressure group to improve planning rights within their communities as well as develop a support base for Palestinian alternative planning initiatives on the community level in or der to raise awareness of the neighbourhood?s people on urban planning + housing issues in the city. The main outputs of the project will be: (i) Capacity Building of at least 72 young lawyers planners architects and community social workers and young acti vists from the neighbourhoods targeting cases in the context of planning crisis and Israeli statutory system, (ii) Raising Awareness of at least 1000 people through public lectures discussing urban planning issues housing issues bureaucratic procedures urb an and housing rights and house demolition issues in the city, (iii) Legal assistance of at least 500 specific cases from the different neighbourhoods, (iv) Publication of a manual documenting interactive tools approaches cases studies and mechanisms of de aling with planning under Israeli restrictions.
